extendedIngredients.name: chicken broth
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (14-1/2 ounces) beef or chicken broth

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes

extendedIngredients.name: smoked sausage
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound Johnsonville® Smoked Sausage, halved and cut into 1/4-inch slices

recipes.title: Forgotten Jambalaya

winePairing.pairingText: Jambalaya can be paired with Albarino, rosé Wine, and Sauvignon Blanc. These low-tannin, lower alcohol wines will complement the heat in spicy cajun dishes, instead of making your mouth burn more. The Salneval Albarino with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 9 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Salneval Albarino
productMatches.description: Light straw in color, the nose of this Albariño is seductive with honey, pear and tropical fruit and a slight mineral component. It is racy andzesty with citrus and floral flavors in the mouth, yet is round and soft at the same time.It matches perfectly with fresh seafood and shellfish; is an ideal accompaniment to salty, spicy Asian cuisine; and is also great on its own as a cocktail wine. Truly adventurous food lovers will amaze and inspire their friends by serving it with the unlikely, but fantastic pairing of traditional barbequed ribs with a sweet, slightly spicy tomato based sauce.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a 5-qt. slow cooker, combine the tomatoes, broth and tomato paste. Stir in the celery, green peppers, onion, garlic and seasonings. Stir in chicken and sausage.                                                                                            Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours or until chicken is no longer pink. Stir in shrimp. Cover and cook 15-30 minutes longer or until shrimp turn pink. Serve with rice.                                        Yield: 11 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Forgotten Jambalaya in  Taste of HomeFebruary/March 2008, p33                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 cup calculated without rice equals 230 calories, 13 g fat (5 g saturated fat), 75 mg cholesterol, 1,016 mg sodium, 9 g carbohydrate, 2 g fiber, 20 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a 5-qt. slow cooker, combine the tomatoes, broth and tomato paste. Stir in the celery, green peppers, onion, garlic and seasonings. Stir in chicken and sausage.
Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours or until chicken is no longer pink. Stir in shrimp. Cover and cook 15-30 minutes longer or until shrimp turn pink.
